TEXT.TITLE: ARGENTINE DEBT TALKS DIFFICULT-CENTRAL BANK HEAD
TEXT.BODY: Central Bank President Jose Luis Machinea said negotiations with creditor banks on Argentina's 30 billion dlr private sector foreign debt were difficult. "There is considerable divergence with the banks. We must try to get them to lower the spreads," Machinea told Reuters. He said negotiations with the steering committee for the country's creditor banks in New York would not end next week. Machinea leaves for New York tomorrow with Treasury Secretary Mario Brodersohn to complete Argentina's team at negotiations with the steering committee for a 2.15 biilion dlr loan to see the country through 1987. Argentina is aiming at four pct growth in 1987 and has said this target is not negotiable. Reuter
